description:
11 people died when BP's Macondo well in the Gulf of Mexico exploded in 2010. It was to become one of the biggest environmental disasters in US history. For nearly three months more than 100 million gallons of oil spilled onto America's southern shoreline. The spill triggered legal action from thousands of householders and businesses for compensation. Well today the US government and five states reached an 18.7-billion-dollar agreement to settle claims for damages following the spill. Florida's Attorney General Pam Bondi said she was thrilled with the settlement.

This is a historic settlement by the way. Have we litigated this? This is a rabbit hole. This is a black hole. We would have been in litigation for years. Regardless of any verdict, this would have been appealed for again, probably our grandchildren would have seen the money.

The deal settles civil claims filed against BP by the US government along with five Gulf coast states. That's Alabama, Florida, Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas.
